file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-72-00-05 - COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR-ACCESS-HATCH WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR-ACCESS-HATCH WARNING - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do a check of the cockpit - underfloor access-hatch caution message. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS ALL 52-72-00-700-801-A ♦ HATCH WARNING - OPERATIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-72-00 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-72-00-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT UNDERFLOOR ACCESS HATCH WARNING - OPERATIONAL CHECK A. General (1) The function of this check is to make sure that the caution message related to the cockpit- underfloor access-hatch is shown on the EICAS display. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 23-41-00/1 ENERGIZATION OF THE AIRCRAFT WITH AN EX- AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200 TERNAL POWER SOURCE C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 Cockpit underfloor access hatch 124 Cockpit underfloor access hatch D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE Out of the aircraft, below the Forward Fu- 1 Does the task selage Does the check of the EICAS display in the 1 Helps the other technician cockpit I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Connect the ramp interphone to permit communication between the mechanics (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Energize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200). (3) Make sure that these doors are closed and locked: EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 52-72-00 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL - Forward-Electronic-Compartment Access Hatch - Rear-Electronic-Compartment Access Hatch - Service Door - Baggage Door - Fueling Panel Door - Passenger - Cabin Escape Hatches - Main Door J. Operationally Check Rigging Door Warning Message (Figure 501) SUBTASK 710-002-A (1) Do the operational check as follows: NOTE: There is a delay of 4 to 5 seconds between the locking of the hatch and the indications shown on the EICAS display. (a) Fully close the cockpit-underfloor access-hatch and, before it locks, monitor the indication on the EICAS display. Result: 1 The EICAS display shows this caution message: - ACCESS DOORS OPN. The MFD shows these indications: - DOOR OPEN (in red). - A red square that shows the cockpit-underfloor-access hatch. (b) Lock the cockpit-underfloor-access hatch and monitor the EICAS display. Result: 1 On the EICAS display, the caution message below goes out of view: - ACCESS DOORS OPN. On the MFD, the indications below go out of view: - DOOR OPEN. - The red square that shows the cockpit-underfloor-access hatch becomes green. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Disconnect the ramp interphone (AMM SDS 23-41-00/1). (2) Deenergize the aircraft ( AMM TASK 20-40-01-860-801-A/200).
